channel.name: Baalor's Lordly Plate (Guardian relic) - Daily Discussion 5 Jul

messages.content: Previous Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

Next Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

__Votes__:
Roundhouse Kick (Hermit card): 5
Change-o! (Gremlins card): 2
Centurion (Collectible card): 0
Daily Discussion 592/921

embeds.title: Baalor's Lordly Plate
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

Whenever you **Brace,** Brace 1 more.
*One can never have enough armor.*

messages.content: how often is this actually relevant
I mean...
<piercing hide>?

embeds.title: Piercing Hide
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 7 (9) **Block** :p_block: and 2 (3) temporary :p_temp: Thorns :p_thorns:.
**Brace** 3.
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: <sentry wave>?

embeds.title: Sentry Wave
embeds.description:
Special Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Downfall

Apply 1 **Weak** :p_weak:.
 **Brace** 2.)
Place a Sentry Blast (+) into **Stasis.**
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: <recover>

embeds.title: Recover
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 5 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
**Brace** 3 (4).
Place a card from your discard pile into **Stasis.**

messages.content: definitely recover
3->4 and 4->5 very relevant
<brace gem>

Getting one more brace is quite often relevant considering it subsequently reduces the ammout of brace cards that you have to play before getting into defensive mode. Getting 1-3 more brace per turn is often the difference between curling up and taking a hit to your face
For a common relic that's really good

It's a very minor improvement to your brace, it can certainly add up, but I don't think I'd buy this at a shop unless I had 5+ cheap sources of brace. For a common it's an okay random drop, but the effect is just quite small for anything other than a deck with tons of brace sources. I usually find that the first defensive mode is easy to enter (especially with curl up and gear up in the starter deck/relic), the second reasonably easy if you put in some work, and the third and beyond are quite difficult to get into.
idk if it's good, but I grab it cause Baalor
it's pretty nice
it's essentially Guardian's <Data Disk>

embeds.title: Data Disk
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Start each combat with 1 **Focus** :p_focus:.
*This disk contains precious data on birds and snakes.*

messages.content: would it be more balanced at +2 brace
or would that be too strong

You can have 3 orbs out at once (more with capacitor or runic capacitor), and you can use loop to effectively multiply your front orb. That's a passive benefit from each orb every single turn with data disk (or any source of focus really), which can give +1 damage to lightning orbs and +1 block to frost orbs, and it also makes evoking them much more valuable. Lordly Plate might trigger once or twice per turn at most, just giving extra brace, getting you a little closer to your next defensive mode. Data Disk is one of the best common relics in the base game, this is nowhere near as good because there aren't that many small sources of brace to trigger it with, and it just helps you reach defensive mode faster once or twice per fight, rather than contributing to multiplicative scaling.
forgot to mention that lordly plate is REALLY good with protocols
Based

I think the effect of this relic is perhaps too niche for a common. The +1 might not ever actually make a difference in your run. Would like to see some data on it, but I wonder if something along the lines of “At the start of combat, Brace 5” or “Entering into Defensive Mode now requires 5 less Brace” would be better and more reliable
Even weak common relics such as Ceramic Fish are likely to do *something* to your run. Or The Boot, depending on your character, though even Strikes benefit from Boot when you’re weakened
Or how about a rework along the lines of “Defensive Mode now grants 12 Block instead of 10”
“Whenever you enter Defensive Mode, gain 2 Plated Armor”

I think this relic sucks in the early game, as it rarely if ever gets you to a threshold you otherwise wouldn't make for the first 20 brace, the only one I can think of is letting you play something like a <roll attack> and unupgraded <curl up> to enter defensive mode

embeds.title: Roll Attack
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 16 (20) damage.
If in Defensive Mode, affects ALL enemies. Otherwise, **Brace** 8.
[ **Socket** ]

embeds.title: Curl Up
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Place a ​~~- random  -~~ card from (in) your hand into **Stasis.**
**Brace** 10 (12).

messages.content: But in late game, this has gotten me 6-8 brace per turn, just because of the sheer amount of brace cards I have and the insane amount of cards you can play thanks to stasis spam.
Good point. There are very few base game commons that suck in the early game. Tiny Chest is the biggest standout
Feels weird as a common
Baalorlord deserves a *solid* relic themed after him
Even less that suck early game but get better in late game, I think tiny chest just isn't a good relic regardless of when you obtain it.
An easy fix could be "the first time you brace in a turn, brace 4"
you can adjust numbers as you see fit
I like this relic, but if I get this from an early elite, event, or chest I am disappointed and I wouldn't buy it from a shop until probably late act 2 to early act 3.
I would gladly grab it early, but that might be my inner greed
One more <priming shot>

embeds.title: Priming Shot
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 8 (10) damage.
**Brace** 4 (6).
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: It's insane on this brace 7 for a one cost
And that's not counting sapphire
For a whopping 12 brace on a 1 cost
Equal to curl up but helpful since it also deals damage
~~build your own mark the path+~~

its very easy to underestimate this relic. It buffs half of guardians card pool and it does make new bench marks for you to activate brace quicker. Its more notable when you are trying to reach 30 or 40 rather then the first 20. Its pretty good as far as common relics go!
Its not top tier, but its pretty likely to help you in most runs you find it in. Which is completely fine for a character relic; especially one on a character as strong as guardian.
I like how there is a wide variety of opinions on this relic
Guardian's Data Disk is [[Sundial]]

embeds.title: Sundial
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Every 3 times you shuffle your draw pile, gain :colorless_energy: :colorless_energy: .
*"Early man's foolish obsession with time caused them to look to the sky for guidance, hoping for something permanent." - Zoroth*

messages.content: The relic that directly supports your primary game plan and that you are elated to see
The Lordly Plate is more like Guardian's The Boot or Specimen - it's never actually negative, it occasionally contributes a small amount of value and you're happy if it does

Nah, specimen or the boot may benefit you once every few turns at their best, absolutely never at their worst, the plate is guaranteed to give you value almost every turn considering how central to the guardian bracing is
Boot and specimen are weak and inconsistent, the plate might be on the weaker side but it's extremely consistent
It is absolutely NOT guaranteed to give you any value at all, especially in hallways where fights are over quicker

I forgot if Brace carries over between Defensive Mode procs, I was lazy and asked AI to run both scenarios assuming you brace for 5 each turn 3 times (which won’t happen early game most likely, by the way)
overbracing WILL carry over between defensive mode entries
That’s what I thought, thanks for confirming

however:
it's a lot easier to brace 4 base than brace 5 base
How many cards brace for 5 at tehir base?
<show3 protocol>

embeds.title: Evasive Protocol
embeds.description:
13.30 / Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

While in Defensive Mode, raise your **Dexterity** :p_dexterity: by 3 (5).
At the start of your turn, **Brace** 3.

embeds.title: Spiker Protocol
embeds.description:
13.30 / Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 4 (6) Thorns :p_thorns: while in Defensive Mode.
At the start of your turn, **Brace** 3.

embeds.title: Revenge Protocol
embeds.description:
13.03 / Rare Power / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

While in Defensive Mode, raise your **Strength** :p_strength: by 2 (3).
At the start of your turn, **Brace** 4 (5).

messages.content: afaik literally just Revenge Protocol+
Most  1 cost cards brace for 3-4 in which case it's a difrence between playing 5-7 cards without the relic or 4-5 cards with it
But that’s not “guaranteed to give you value almost every turn”. It MIGHT give you value the first time you enter Defensive and rarely for subsequent times
Nah, it's literally <snecko skull>

embeds.title: Snecko Skull
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Whenever you apply Poison :p_poison:, apply an additional 1 Poison :p_poison:.
*A snecko skull in pristine condition. Mysteriously clean and smooth, dirt and grime fall off inexplicably.*

messages.content: it is quite literally the opposite, it's a lot less likely to help the first time, but as you use more and more instances of brace it helps more
There won’t be a second time in many hallways
